content.raw: I included the Pose header in SDFExtension, since it's a more minimal inclusion.
content.html: I included the Pose header in SDFExtension, since it's a more minimal inclusion.

content.raw:
I tried to resolve conflicts, and I broke it.
~~~
In file included from /Users/scpeters/osrf/sdformat/src/SDFExtension.cc:18:
/Users/scpeters/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/SDFExtension.hh:53:13: error: use of
      undeclared identifier 'ignition'
    public: ignition::math::Pose3d reductionTransform;
            ^
1 error generated.
~~~
Should we include `ignition/math.hh` in `Types.hh`? Or should we explicitly include the ignition Pose header in `SDFExtension.hh` instead?
content.html:
I tried to resolve conflicts, and I broke it.

In file included from /Users/scpeters/osrf/sdformat/src/SDFExtension.cc:18:
/Users/scpeters/osrf/sdformat/include/sdf/SDFExtension.hh:53:13: error: use of
      undeclared identifier 'ignition'
    public: ignition::math::Pose3d reductionTransform;
            ^
1 error generated.

Should we include ignition/math.hh in Types.hh? Or should we explicitly include the ignition Pose header in SDFExtension.hh instead?

content.raw:
Looks like we need the DLL visibility macros in `ign-math`:
~~~
D:\Jenkins\workspace\sdformat-any-devel-windows7-amd64\workspace\sdformat\include\sdf/parser_urdf.hh(142) :
 warning C4251: 'sdf::SDFExtension::oldLinkName' : class 'std::basic_string<char,std::char_traits<char>,std::allocator<char>>'
 needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class 'sdf::SDFExtension'
~~~
content.html:
Looks like we need the DLL visibility macros in ign-math:

D:\Jenkins\workspace\sdformat-any-devel-windows7-amd64\workspace\sdformat\include\sdf/parser_urdf.hh(142) :
 warning C4251: 'sdf::SDFExtension::oldLinkName' : class 'std::basic_string<char,std::char_traits<char>,std::allocator<char>>'
 needs to have dll-interface to be used by clients of class 'sdf::SDFExtension'

content.raw: This was suppose to be a list of dependencies that would get processed in `sdf_config.cmake.in`. This would work if each dependency behaved the same, such as using the same format for include directory variables. Since this doesn't work very well in practice, I've broken out each dependency in `sdf_config.cmake.in`.
content.html: This was suppose to be a list of dependencies that would get processed in sdf_config.cmake.in. This would work if each dependency behaved the same, such as using the same format for include directory variables. Since this doesn't work very well in practice, I've broken out each dependency in sdf_config.cmake.in.
